data.key: Risks Related to Self-Driving Unit Economics
data.value: Aurora’s self-driving unit economics may not materialize as expected due to uncertainties in the transition to Driver as a Service.
Significant coordination with third-party fleet partners is required to manage costs effectively.

data.key: Impact of Leadership on Business Strategy
data.value: Dependence on the Chief Executive Officer, Chris Urmson, is critical for maintaining business strategy execution.
Strong competition for qualified personnel may hinder maximizing business potential.

data.key: Potential Stock Impact on Employee Retention
data.value: Reduction in common stock value may necessitate larger equity awards to retain employees.

elements.title: Exclusive Forum Provision and Corporate Governance Issues

data.value: Any person or entity purchasing or otherwise acquiring any interest in any of our securities shall be deemed to have notice of and consented to this provision.
This exclusive forum provision may limit a stockholder’s ability to bring a claim in a judicial forum of its choosing for disputes with us or our directors, officers or other employees.
This exclusive forum provision will not apply to any causes of action arising under the Securities Act or the Exchange Act.
The enforceability of similar choice of forum provisions in other companies’ charter documents has been challenged in legal proceedings.
The Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware recently determined that a provision stating U.S. federal district courts are the exclusive forum is not enforceable.
If a court were to find either exclusive forum provision in our Bylaws to be inapplicable, we may incur additional costs.
Our Certificate of Incorporation and Bylaws contain provisions that could delay or prevent a change in control.
Authorizing our Board of Directors to issue preferred stock could discourage a takeover attempt.
Prohibiting cumulative voting in the election of directors.
Vacancies on our Board may only be filled by a majority of directors then in office.
Limiting the liability and indemnification of our directors and officers.
Board of Directors can amend the Bylaws to inhibit unsolicited takeovers.
Prohibiting stockholder action by written consent.
Limiting who may call special meetings of stockholders.
Requiring advance notification of stockholder nominations.
These provisions may frustrate or prevent any attempts by stockholders to replace or remove management.
Provisions of Section 203 of the DGCL govern Aurora and may prohibit large stockholders from merging without consent.
These provisions could discourage potential takeover attempts and reduce the price investors might be willing to pay.

elements.title: Table of Contents and Income Tax Components

data.key: Common Stock Excluded from Diluted Loss per Share (Summary)
data.value: This table shows the breakdown of equity-related instruments and liabilities over three years (2020-2022). Notable trends include a significant increase in RSUs from 35 to 103 between 2021 and 2022, while stock options decreased from 82 to 65. The total value increased substantially from 3 in 2020 to 143 in 2021, and further to 194 in 2022, primarily driven by increases in stock options and RSUs. Public warrants, private placement warrants, and earnout shares liability remained stable between 2021 and 2022.

This table presents deferred income benefit figures for 2021 and 2022. For 2021, it shows federal tax benefit of $(4), state tax benefit of $(3), resulting in a total deferred income tax benefit of $(5). The income tax benefit totals $(5). No values are reported for 2022. All figures appear to be negative (indicating tax benefits rather than expenses).

This table presents a tax rate reconciliation showing the components that affect the company's effective tax rate from 2020 to 2022. The federal statutory tax rate remained constant at 21.0% across all years. Notable items include significant changes in valuation allowance, a goodwill impairment impact of -13.6% in 2022, and varying R&D credits. The effective tax rate was 0.6% in 2021 and approximately 0% in both 2020 and 2022.

elements.title: Conversion of Class B Common Stock and Preferred Stock Authority

data.key: Conversion of Class B Common Stock
data.value: Each share of Class B Common Stock is convertible into one share of Class A Common Stock at the option of the holder.
Shares of Class B Common Stock will automatically convert into Class A upon transfer except for certain described transfers.
Transfers for estate planning where control is retained will not trigger conversion.
Upon the death of a holder, Class B shares convert to Class A shares.
Conversion is deferred for Aurora Founders' shares for 9 to 18 months upon death or disability.
Shares controlled by spouses will convert upon divorce if they retain control.
The Board can issue preferred stock and set terms without stockholder vote.
Issuance of preferred stock may delay change of control and affect market price.
There are no current plans to issue preferred stock.
Certain holders have rights to require registration of their shares.

Three classes serving staggered three-year terms.

Structured to allow redemption of all outstanding warrants when shares of Class A Common Stock trade at or above $10.00 per share.
Differs from typical warrant redemption features which usually redeem warrants only for cash when shares trade above $18.00.
Warrants have an exercise price of $11.50.
This redemption feature provides certainty about the capital structure by removing outstanding warrants.
Holders may receive fewer shares if warrants are redeemed at prices below exercise price.

data.key: Investing in our securities involves a high degree of risk.
data.value: The trading price of our common stock could decline, and you may lose all or part of your investment.

data.key: Self-driving technology is an emerging technology.
data.value: We face significant technical challenges to commercialize our technology.

data.key: We are an early stage company with a history of losses.
data.value: We expect to incur significant expenses and continuing losses for the foreseeable future.
Makes it difficult to evaluate our future prospects and the risks and challenges we may encounter.
Some market participants have substantially greater resources.
May not be accepted and adopted by the market at the pace we expect or at all.
We may require significantly more additional capital investment than previously expected.
Highly dependent on the services of our senior management team.

data.key: Future capital needs and securities sales.
data.value: May require us to sell additional equity or debt securities.
We may experience difficulties in managing our growth and expanding our operations.

data.key: Operating and financial results projections depend on assumptions.
data.value: Correctness of assumptions or analyses is uncertain.
Could fail to successfully select, execute or integrate.
Risks to operational systems and data security.

data.key: Privacy and data protection compliance failures.
data.value: May adversely impact our business.
Our future insurance coverage may not be adequate to protect us from all business risks or may be prohibitively expensive.
Our warrants are accounted for as liabilities and the changes in value of our warrants could have a material effect on our financial results.

If we are unable to develop and maintain an effective system of internal control over financial reporting, we may not be able to accurately report our financial results in a timely manner, which may adversely affect investor confidence in us and materially and adversely affect our business and operating results.

Unanticipated changes in effective tax rates, adverse outcomes resulting from examination of our income, changes in tax laws or regulations, changes in our ability to utilize our net operating loss, or other tax-related changes could materially and adversely affect our business, prospects, financial condition and results of operations.
Our success is contingent on our ability to successfully maintain, manage, execute and expand on our existing partnerships and obtain new partnerships.

We are dependent on our suppliers, some of which are single or limited source suppliers, and these suppliers may not produce and deliver necessary and industrialized components at prices and volumes and on terms acceptable to us.

Burdensome regulations, inconsistent regulations, or a failure to receive regulatory approvals of our technology could have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition and results of operation.
We may become involved in legal and regulatory proceedings and commercial or contractual disputes.
We may be subject to product liability that could result in significant direct or indirect costs.
We may not be able to adequately protect or enforce our intellectual property rights, in which case our business and competitive position could be harmed.
We may need to defend ourselves against intellectual property rights infringement claims, which may be time-consuming and could cause us to incur substantial costs.
We could lose the ability to use certain intellectual property rights and technology or materials that we rely upon if the underlying license agreements are terminated or not renewed.

Our software contains third-party open-source software components, and failure to comply with the terms of the underlying open-source software licenses could restrict our ability to sell our products or give rise to disclosure obligations of proprietary software.
The market price of our common stock may be volatile and could decline significantly.

Our dual class structure has the effect of concentrating voting power with our founders, which limits an investor’s ability to influence the outcome of important transactions, including a change in control.

elements.title: Risks Related to Our Technology, Business Model and Industry

data.value: Self-driving technology is an emerging technology and we face significant technical challenges to commercialize our technology.
If we cannot successfully overcome those challenges or do so on a timely basis, our ability to grow our business will be negatively impacted.
The industry has an expectation for better-than-a-human driving performance.
Large funding requirements pose a challenge.
There are long vehicle development lead times.
Specialized skills and expertise requirements of personnel are necessary.
Inconsistent and evolving regulatory frameworks present challenges.
Building public trust and brand image is critical.
Real world operation of entirely new technology is complex.
We expect to incur significant operating and net losses for the foreseeable future.
We have incurred net losses annually since inception.
The rate of losses is expected to be substantially higher as we scale development.
Development may not realize expected revenues.
Makes it difficult to evaluate future prospects and risks.
Design, develop, test, and validate for commercial applications.
Produce and deliver technology at an acceptable level.
Challenge in properly pricing products and services.
Manage capital expenditures for current and future products.
Hire, integrate and retain talented people.
Forecast revenue, budget and manage expenses.
Attract new partners and retain existing ones.
Navigate an evolving and complex regulatory landscape.
Manage supply chain and supplier relationships.
Anticipate and respond to macroeconomic changes.
Maintain and enhance the value of reputation and brand.
Effectively manage growth and business operations.
Develop and protect IP rights.
Develop new solutions, features, and applications.

elements.title: Risk Factors Related to Disruptions and Natural Catastrophes

data.value: Our business is subject to risks of earthquakes, fire, floods, and other natural catastrophic events, global pandemics, and interruptions by man-made problems, such as terrorism.
The COVID-19 pandemic may heighten demand for products, ability to maintain profitability, and ability to raise capital.

data.key: Potential disruptions from terror or geopolitics
data.value: Geopolitical tensions related to Russia’s actions in Ukraine could cause disruptions.
We rely on information technology systems for communication and any disruption could adversely affect our business.
We do not have a formal disaster recovery plan or require our partners to have such plans.
Recovery from COVID-19 may be impeded by new variants or other factors, leading to adverse impacts.
AWS and other technology systems reliability are crucial for business continuity, subject to various risks.
We are subject to cybersecurity risks to operational systems, security systems, infrastructure, integrated software and partners' and end-customers data processed by us or third-party vendors.
Loss of trade secrets or proprietary information, interruption of operational systems, damage to confidential information.
Disasters, insiders, malicious third parties using sophisticated methods.
Increased risk of security breaches and cyberattacks due to more personnel working remotely.
Information technology measures, formal incident response plan.
No guarantee that measures will be adequate to prevent or mitigate incidents.
Disruption of data management, procurement, production execution, etc.
Reliance on third-party service providers for data integrity.
Insurance may not cover losses from cyber incidents.
Significant adverse effects on business, financial condition, and operations.

The company relies on proprietary technology, trade secrets, and contractual measures to protect sensitive information, but faces risks of unauthorized disclosure and challenges in enforcing rights.

Fair value is defined as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.
The three levels of the fair value hierarchy are Level 1 (Observable inputs), Level 2 (Observable inputs other than Level 1 prices), Level 3 (Unobservable inputs).

data.value: Requires approval of at least two-thirds of the outstanding voting power of common stock.

Board has authority to issue up to 1,000,000,000 shares of undesignated preferred stock.
Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware is the exclusive forum for certain actions.

Amendments will not reduce the effect of prior actions or claims.
